question: Wrong regarding aplastic anemia
choices: Caused by direct and immunologic injury to hematopoietic stem cells
Presence of organomegaly or LAP is unlikely
Initial blood cell count does not determine outcome
Can be phenotypic expression of myelodysplasia and leukemia
answer: Initial blood cell count does not determine outcome

question: All correctly describe about CML, except
choices: The commonest type of leukemia in Ethiopia
Ph(+) CML has poor prognosis than Ph(-) CML
Infection and bleeding is unusual in chronic phase
Extramedullary blast proliferation indicates blast crisis
Allogeneic bone marrow transplantation is gold standard therapy
answer: Ph(+) CML has poor prognosis than Ph(-) CML

question: All of the following correctly describe regarding CLL, except
choices: Treatment modalities are palliative in general
Etiology in majority of cases is unknown
Defective immune surveillance occurs in CLL
All cases of CLL are candidates for chemotherapy
BM examination predicts prognosis in CLL
answer: All cases of CLL are candidates for chemotherapy

question: Not poor prognostic indicator in CLL
Not characteristic feature of Hodgkins lymphoma
Unfavourable international prognostic indicator (IPI) in Non-Hodgkins lymphoma, except
One of the following is NOT a cause for pleural effusion
Which of the following conditions would be expected to increase the residual volume of the lung?
Which of the following medications used as antimycobacterial drugs require dose reduction for patients with an estimated glomerular filtration rate <30 mL/min?
Screening for Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection is indicated in HIV patients at the time of initial diagnosis for all of the following reasons EXCEPT
choices: Active tuberculosis treatment success rates are lower in HIV-infected patients compared to HIV-uninfected patients.
Drug interactions between drug regimens for active tuberculosis therapy and highly active antiretroviral therapy are challenging to manage.
HIV-associated active tuberculosis is more likely to be extrapulmonary and diagnostically challenging.
HIV-infected patients with active tuberculosis have high 6-month HIV-related mortality rates.
The rate of progression from latent tuberculosis to active tuberculosis is higher in HIV-infected persons compared to HIV-uninfected persons
answer: HIV-infected patients with active tuberculosis have high 6-month HIV-related mortality rates.

question: Pulmonary thromboembolism (PTE)
choices: Serum D-dimer is the gold standard diagnostic modality
Hypotension indicates severe form of the disease than right ventricular hypokinesis
Anticoagulation with heparin and warfarin clears the thrombus
A normal CT Scan excludes PTE
answer: Serum D-dimer is the gold standard diagnostic modality

Which of the following does not complicate type A chronic atrophic gastritis

Which of the following infections is common during defects in the complement system?

A 34 years old HIV patient presented with amenorrhea of 2 months duration. Her CD4 count was 300 cells/µl. She is started on anti-tuberculosis before 3 weeks and has tolerated the medications. The only other abnormality from the other investigation was that she was positive for HBsAg. Which of the following is better option for the management of this patient?
Which one is correct concerning visceral leishmaniasis treatment?
choices: Definitive cure is defined after six months of treatment
Test of cure negative patients will not relapse
SSG has better safety profile than AmBisome
Relapse is common after the first year of the initial treatment
Relapsed cases are less symptomatic and easily treatable
answer: Definitive cure is defined after six months of treatment

question: A medical student who went for TTP program to Gorgora (small town by the side of Lake Tana) presented with fever, arthralgia, diarrhea and headache. His body temperature was 39ºC, and he had tender cervical, axillary and inguinal lymphadenopathy. The blood film was negative for hemoparasite. The WBC count was 15,000/µl with 50% eosinophilia. Which of the following medication is important for his treatment?
Which one of the following is not important for the management of relapsing fever?
Not a typical feature of the nephrotic syndrome
Not given for the management of hyperkalemia:
Not given for acute post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis
Diffuse symmetric arthritis with pulmonary nodules most probably signifies
A complication of chronic renal failure
Not true regarding cobalamin deficiency anemia
choices: Characterized by cytoplasmic immaturity in hematopoietic cells
Neuropsychiatric symptoms and signs can occur
Macrocytosis and hypersegmented neutrophils in peripheral smear
Serum methylmalonate and homocysteine levels are increased
Schilling test helps to diagnose GIT causes of cobalamin deficiency
answer: Characterized by cytoplasmic immaturity in hematopoietic cells

question: All the following may cause elevation of serum troponin EXCEPT
When deciding whether to initiate anticoagulation for a patient with atrial fibrillation, which of the following factors is LEAST important?

choices: Acute coronary syndrome with anteroseptal infarction
Acute coronary syndrome with inferior wall infarction

A 40 year-old female presents to the Gondar University Hospital because of hemoptysis. She has coughed up approximately 1 teaspoon of blood for the last 4 days. She has a history of cigarette smoking. A chest radiogram shows diffuse bilateral infiltrates predominantly in the lower lobes. The hematocrit is 30%, and the serum creatinine is 4.0 mg/dL. Both were normal previously. Urinalysis shows 2+ protein and red blood cell casts. The presence of autoantibodies directed against which of the following is most likely to yield a definitive diagnosis?
One of the following is FALSE about Sarcoidosis
choices: Cervical lymph nodes are commonly affected
Non caseous granuloma is its feature
Upper lung lobes are usually involved
Serum level of angiotensin converting enzyme level has a prognostic advantage
answer: Cervical lymph nodes are commonly affected

question: TRUE about Interstitial Lung Disease
choices: Smoking induces some variants of it
Hyper inflated lungs on Chest X-ray
High resolution CT Scan is an etiologic diagnostic modality
Majority of them have obstructive feature on Spirometry
Pulmonary hypertension less common as compared to COPD
answer: Smoking induces some variants of it

question: Not features of Anterior cerebral artery occlusion
choices: Greater contralateral arm weakness than leg weakness
answer: Greater contralateral arm weakness than leg weakness

question: Which of the following is correct regarding hypertensive intraparenchymal hemorrhage, except
choices: Basal ganglia is common site of bleeding
Light reactive pin point pupil occurs in pontine hemorrhage
Eye deviation towards the hemiparesis occurs in putaminal hemorrhage
Surgical intervention may be required in cerebellar hemorrhage
answer: Basal ganglia is common site of bleeding

question: Wrongly describes feature of subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH)
choices: Sudden headache with out focal neurologic deficit is hall mark of SAH
Non-contrast CT scan visualizes most cases of SAH
Non-clotting, non-clearing bloody tap in 3-tube test occurs in SAH
3H-therapy is modality of therapy in unclipped or uncoiled SAH

question: Not complication of migraine
Which of the following wrongly describes about brain abscess
choices: Direct spread from contagious site is major route of infection
Hematogenous spread tends to result in multifocal abscess
Fronto-temporal abscess is major site of brain abscess
Surgical excision is preferred than needle aspiration as surgical modality of therapy
Reduced level of consciousness on admission has poor prognosis
answer: Surgical excision is preferred than needle aspiration as surgical modality of therapy

question: Not correctly describes about intra-medullary spinal cord lesion
choices: Relatively early bladder and bowel dysfunction

question: Not true regarding acute bacterial meningitis
choices: S.pneumoniae is the commonest causative agent in adults
Fever, headache and nuchal rigidity are the clinical triads
Early onset-seizure has poor prognosis than delayed onset-seizure
Hyponatremia is the commonly observed electrolyte abnormality
answer: Early onset-seizure has poor prognosis than delayed onset-seizure

question: All of the following are common consequences of congenital heart disease in the adult EXCEPT
All the following patients should be evaluated for secondary causes of hypertension EXCEPT
choices: A 25 years old female with hematuria and blood pressure of 160/90
A 32 years old male with strong family history of hypertension and renal failure who blood pressure of 150/95
A 40 years old male with with blood pressure of 160/90,otherwise normal.
A 30 years old female with complaints of severe headaches, weight gain, and new onset diabetes with bold pressure of 140/85
E 45 years old whose blood pressure has become increasingly difficult to control on four antihypertensive agents
answer: A 40 years old male with with blood pressure of 160/90,otherwise normal.

In Addison's disease
